main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported around Walnut Ridge AFS, Arkansas in March 1958, including a sighting of a solid, well-defined target on radar at high speeds, a shiny oval-shaped object with a circular wake, a greenish-white object moving at high speed, and a bright, glowing object hovering in the sky.
interesting points: The radar in Walnut Ridge AFS, Arkansas, picked up a solid, well-defined target moving at 1500 knots before disappearing from view.
Witnesses in Eureka, California, observed a shiny oval-shaped object with a circular, cloud-like wake moving through the sky.
The sighting of a greenish-white object at Walnut Ridge AFS, Arkansas, was described as extremely bright, moving at a high rate of speed and disappearing from view after approximately 20 seconds.
A 24-year-old man, his younger brother, and friends observed a bright, glowing object hovering in the sky, which eventually disappeared after shooting straight up into the air over Pontiac, Arkansas.
The witness reports were made by credible observers, including radar operators, Air Force personnel, and civilians, with similar descriptions of the objects' behavior.
sighted object: solid, well-defined target on radar, shiny oval-shaped object, greenish-white glowing object, bright, glowing object
location: Walnut Ridge AFS, Arkansas and Pontiac, Arkansas
witnesses: radar operators, Air Force personnel, civilians
